block.p: Gardens: The Country Place Era Paine Webber Gallery, 1285 Avenue of the Americas (51st Street); (800) 777-7931.
Gardens: The Country Place Era Paine Webber Gallery, 1285 Avenue of the Americas (51st Street); (800) 777-7931.

The American Horticultural Society is sponsoring a symposium on American garden design from 1895 to 1939. Charles Platt, Marian C. Coffin and Florence Yoch are some designers whose work will be discussed at the symposium, on March 15 from 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. Fee, $100. Wednesday is deadline for registration. Green Spaces Brooklyn Botanic Garden, 1000 Washington Avenue (Eastern Parkway), Prospect Heights; (718) 622-4433.

"Making Brooklyn Bloom," a program of lectures and workshops about urban gardening, will be held on Sunday from 1 to 4 P.M. Topics will include how to start seeds indoors, window gardening, pest management and sources for gardening supplies. Free. Garden Films Clark Botanic Garden, 193 I. U. Willets Road, off Glen Cove Road, Albertson, L.I.; (516) 621-7568.

A series of horticulture films starts on Tuesday with "Pruning Practices." The programs, at 2 P.M., will cover planting and transplanting (March 12), herbs (March 19) and dried flowers (March 26). Free with garden admission: $2; $1 for children ages 6 to 16 and those 62 and older.
Orientation for volunteer tour guides at the garden will be offered next Thursday from 10 A.M. to noon, with follow-up sessions in March. Call Urte Schaedle for information.
